revised_title: On the Total Solar Eclipse of August 29, 1886: Photographic Results and Observations
tldr: This article presents the results and observations of the total solar eclipse of August 29, 1886, with a focus on photographic techniques and the study of the corona. The authors describe their preparations, equipment, and findings from Prickly Point and Carriacou Island, providing valuable insights into the nature of the solar corona and the methods used to capture its image.
